title: forge coverage not showing up contracts.
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [x] Foundry
- [x] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (2097194 2023-06-23T00:10:47.525915714Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge coverage

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

I made two contracts, so when I run forge coverage it is showing stats of only one contract and there is no field for another contract.
Two Contracts in src folder with name: MyToken.sol and KittyToken.sol
When I run forge coverage it is showing stats for MyToken.sol but not for KittyToken.sol

I just thought that maybe it can be due to importing ERC20 contract. Then I put the same code of the contract KittyToken.sol in MyToken.sol and the MyToken.sol contract was gone too from forge coverage table.

![image](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/111875681/fe66c005-3e9e-48e1-9d92-d6810161f374)
![image](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/111875681/2e7c09cd-8e02-4a75-8d05-a6397a4168e2)


When I run forge tree, output is:
```
script/DeployKittyToken.s.sol ^0.8.18
├── lib/forge-std/src/Script.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/Base.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   │   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdStorage.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   │   │   └── lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   │   └── lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/console.sol >=0.4.22 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/console2.sol >=0.4.22 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdChains.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   │   └── lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdCheats.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   │   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdStorage.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0 (*)
│   │   ├── lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   │   └── lib/forge-std/src/console2.sol >=0.4.22 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdJson.sol >=0.6.0 <0.9.0
│   │   └── lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdMath.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdStorage.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0 (*)
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdUtils.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   │   ├── lib/forge-std/src/interfaces/IMulticall3.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   │   └── lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   └── lib/forge-std/src/Base.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0 (*)
└── src/KittyToken.sol ^0.8.18
    └── lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol ^0.8.0
        ├── lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol ^0.8.0
        ├── lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/IERC20Metadata.sol ^0.8.0
        │   └── lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol ^0.8.0
        └── lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Context.sol ^0.8.0
src/KittyToken.sol ^0.8.18 (*)
src/MyToken.sol ^0.8.18
test/unit/KittyTokenTest.t.sol ^0.8.18
├── lib/forge-std/src/Test.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/console.sol >=0.4.22 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/console2.sol >=0.4.22 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdAssertions.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   │   ├── lib/forge-std/lib/ds-test/src/test.sol >=0.5.0
│   │   └── lib/forge-std/src/StdMath.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdChains.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0 (*)
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdCheats.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0 (*)
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdError.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdInvariant.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdJson.sol >=0.6.0 <0.9.0 (*)
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdMath.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdStorage.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0 (*)
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdUtils.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0 (*)
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/StdStyle.sol >=0.4.22 <0.9.0
│   │   └── lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0
│   ├── lib/forge-std/src/Base.sol >=0.6.2 <0.9.0 (*)
│   └── lib/forge-std/lib/ds-test/src/test.sol >=0.5.0
├── script/DeployKittyToken.s.sol ^0.8.18 (*)
└── src/KittyToken.sol ^0.8.18 (*)
```

I have been playing around a bit with the code to see if there is an issue with the coverage but, I don't think there is one. From what I saw Foundry takes the following steps to calculate a project's test coverage:
- compile the project.
- examine the compilation output to identify the functions defined in the. contracts.
- run the test suite to identify which functions are covered by tests and which ones are not.
- Produce the coverage report

In your example, the `KittyToken` does not have any function defined although it does inherit from the `ERC20` contract. When Foundry checks the code for the `KittyToken` contract it does not find any function and so it does not include it in the coverage report.  

I have reproduced the `KittyToken` contract on my machine and, after adding a function to it. it does appear in the coverage report.

```solidity
// SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED
pragma solidity ^0.8.13;

import {ERC20} from "@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC20/ERC20.sol";

contract KittyToken is ERC20 {

    constructor(uint256 _supply) ERC20("Meow", "Paw") {
        _mint(msg.sender, _supply);
    }

    function increment() public {}
}
```

Terminal output:

```shell
➜ forge coverage
[⠒] Compiling...
[⠢] Compiling 28 files with 0.8.20
[⠰] Solc 0.8.20 finished in 2.06s
Compiler run successful!
Analysing contracts...
Running tests...
| File                 | % Lines       | % Statements  | % Branches    | % Funcs       |
|----------------------|---------------|---------------|---------------|---------------|
| script/Counter.s.sol | 0.00% (0/1)   | 0.00% (0/1)   | 100.00% (0/0) | 0.00% (0/2)   |
| src/Counter.sol      | 100.00% (2/2) | 100.00% (2/2) | 100.00% (0/0) | 100.00% (2/2) |
| src/KittyToken.sol   | 100.00% (0/0) | 100.00% (0/0) | 100.00% (0/0) | 0.00% (0/1)   |
| Total                | 66.67% (2/3)  | 66.67% (2/3)  | 100.00% (0/0) | 40.00% (2/5)  |

```

Yes, got it.
Ok, so I made a contract having 1 function and made ```KittyToken``` contract to inherit it, and now it was showing the ```KittyToken``` contract in coverage even though there was no single function in there.

So, what I found out is, when we import contract, and inherit it, it will not show up the main contract in coverage. But if we make the contract that we want to inherit in same file as of main contract file, then it shows up the main contract.
Thanks, I got it now. I just misunderstood it. Actually it is showing the file, because it contains the contract that has its own function.

![image](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/111875681/cf485fb0-6cbb-4348-988d-2782bf9817cc)
![image](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/assets/111875681/1e9e2537-2b4d-4b93-a02d-201dc1e528e2)
Thanks @xeno097 for the help! I believe we can close this now.
